metadata.name: King of the Castles
metadata.description:
If you want to explore Scotland's history, look no further than the mighty castle. Kilchurn, a 15th century ruin on the banks of Loch Awe, is my personal favourite. On a fortuitous visit, the wind was still and the vibrant colours were on full display. I felt this image highlighted the beauty of the castle, but also the history of what might have happened on these shores and within these walls. If only we could know.

15% of the proceeds will be donated to Historic Environment, the leading public body who investigate and promote Scotlandâ€™s ancient sites, including Kilchurn Castle. They also train craftspeople in the upkeep of buildings, conserve treasured archives and protect invaluable assets.

1/1 NFT holder is free to use on social media, private display and in virtual galleries, as long as the creditor is credited. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise, commercial distribution or derivative works. Copyright remains with the creator.

Includes an art print if desired.
